snippet: President Obama escalated the response to the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria on Friday, recruiting allies to help crush the group and outlining a strategy that echoes the war on terror.
abstract: Pres Obama recruits at least nine allies to help crush Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; Obama, speaking at NATO summit, offers outlines of coordinated military strategy that echoes war on terror developed by George W Bush; says effort would rely on deploying American airstrikes, strengthening moderate Syrian rebel groups and enlisting friendly governments in region to join fight.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama escalated the response to the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria on Friday, recruiting allies to help crush the group and outlining a strategy that echoes the war on terror.

headline.main: Obama Enlists 9 Allies to Help in the Battle Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: Obama Recruits 9 Allied Nations to Combat ISIS
